title: The 7 Up-And-Coming Shoe Trends to Know About Before Fall
description: We’d recommend shopping them now before everyone else catches on.
excerpt: The early bird gets the snakeskin Mary Janes.
text: If only you could see the workspace of a market editor in the aftermath of fashion month. In a word, it’s insanity. From scribbled notes on airplane napkins to clandestine photos shared via Google Drive, we take in all there is to see across New York, London, Milan, and Paris in order to present you with the most important tidbits. In case you haven’t guessed by now, that’s exactly what this story is for: to let you in on the hottest up-and-coming shoe trends for fall. Eat your heart out. Runway SneakersWe’re always excited to see sneakers trending, but this latest crop is truly spectacular. Between Adidas’s ballet sneaker to Gucci’s anklet style, it’s no wonder why trainers made appearances at Miu Miu, Lacoste, Coperni, and Cecilie Bahnsen.Shop Runway SneakersAdidas Originals Taekwondo Mei Ballet SneakersChloé Kick Suede SneakersThe Row Owen Sneakers Gucci Re-Motion Sneaker Valentino Garavani Chromathon SneakerSnake According to Chinese tradition, 2025 is the year of the snake; and according to fashion month, it’s also the year of snakeskin. From sculptural mules at Duran Lantnik, to boots fit for a Bratz doll at Tod’s, all signs point to this print as the next big shoe trend. (Spoiler alert: it’s trending for bags, too.) Although we have nothing against an open toe, the real runway trend at shows like Fendi and Ferragamo was a bit more discreet. Show off just a small sliver of skin without revealing your full pedicure—or lack thereof.Shop Peep ToesTory Burch Pierced Peep-Toe SlingbackAlaïa Leather Peep-Toe MuleGabriela Hearst Ares Suede Platform MuleAmina Muaddi Julianne 90 Peep Toe Nappa PumpNow 10% OffAcne Studios Open Toe Leather Boots Western Nods Western inspiration has featured prominently throughout the last several seasons, but this fall, the vibe is a bit more subtle. Instead of classic cowboy boots, think silver toe caps on a pair of Louis Vuittons, a snip toe from Hermès, or muted stitching from Schiaparelli. Shop Western NodsMiu Miu Block Heel BootieParis Texas Jessie Mid Calf 75 BootGivenchy Western Ankle BootsNow 39% OffCoperni Petal Bridge Leather Cowboy Boots Ulla Johnson Willow Twisted Ring Cowboy BootsHigh Ankle Straps Move over Mary-Janes, there’s a new strap in town. From heavy hitters like Calvin Klein and Valentino to queen of boho Isabel Marant, many designers opted for straps that sit higher on the ankle for their fall collections. For Loewe, Balmain, and Louis Vuitton, this fall is the time to get slouchy. Be it stark or with rounded corners, we took note of the styles from Alaïa, Victoria Beckham, and Stella McCartney, in particular. html:
If only you could see the workspace of a market editor in the aftermath of fashion month. In a word, it’s insanity. From scribbled notes on airplane napkins to clandestine photos shared via Google Drive, we take in all there is to see across New York, London, Milan, and Paris in order to present you with the most important tidbits. In case you haven’t guessed by now, that’s exactly what this story is for: to let you in on the hottest up-and-coming shoe trends for fall. Eat your heart out.

Runway Sneakers

We’re always excited to see sneakers trending, but this latest crop is truly spectacular. Between Adidas’s ballet sneaker to Gucci’s anklet style, it’s no wonder why trainers made appearances at Miu Miu, Lacoste, Coperni, and Cecilie Bahnsen.

Shop Runway Sneakers

Adidas Originals Taekwondo Mei Ballet Sneakers

Chloé Kick Suede Sneakers

The Row Owen Sneakers

Gucci Re-Motion Sneaker

Valentino Garavani Chromathon Sneaker

Snake

According to Chinese tradition, 2025 is the year of the snake; and according to fashion month, it’s also the year of snakeskin. From sculptural mules at Duran Lantnik, to boots fit for a Bratz doll at Tod’s, all signs point to this print as the next big shoe trend. (Spoiler alert: it’s trending for bags, too.)

Shop Snakeskin Shoes

Dries Van Noten Snake-Effect Leather Sneakers

Aeyde Aline Leather Mary-Jane Pumps

Jimmy Choo Rya 90 Mules

Rejina Pyo Rise Snakeskin-Print Leather Ankle Boots

Jacquemus Snake-Effect Leather Ballet Mule

Peep Toe

Note here that it’s peep toe, not open toe. Although we have nothing against an open toe, the real runway trend at shows like Fendi and Ferragamo was a bit more discreet. Show off just a small sliver of skin without revealing your full pedicure—or lack thereof.

Shop Peep Toes

Tory Burch Pierced Peep-Toe Slingback

Alaïa Leather Peep-Toe Mule

Gabriela Hearst Ares Suede Platform Mule

Amina Muaddi Julianne 90 Peep Toe Nappa Pump

Now 10% Off

Acne Studios Open Toe Leather Boots

Western Nods

Western inspiration has featured prominently throughout the last several seasons, but this fall, the vibe is a bit more subtle. Instead of classic cowboy boots, think silver toe caps on a pair of Louis Vuittons, a snip toe from Hermès, or muted stitching from Schiaparelli.

Shop Western Nods

Miu Miu Block Heel Bootie

Paris Texas Jessie Mid Calf 75 Boot

Givenchy Western Ankle Boots

Now 39% Off

Coperni Petal Bridge Leather Cowboy Boots

Ulla Johnson Willow Twisted Ring Cowboy Boots

High Ankle Straps

Move over Mary-Janes, there’s a new strap in town. From heavy hitters like Calvin Klein and Valentino to queen of boho Isabel Marant, many designers opted for straps that sit higher on the ankle for their fall collections.

Shop High Ankle Straps

Magda Butrym Wedge Sandal

Saint Laurent Jodie 145 Platform Leather Sandals

Alaïa Patent Ankle-Strap Stiletto Pumps

Tom Ford Lock Python Embossed Ankle-Cuff Sandals

Maison Margiela Tabi Ankle Strap Pump

Slouchy Boots

Gone are the days of skin tight boot shafts that can fit nary a sock, let alone a pant leg. For Loewe, Balmain, and Louis Vuitton, this fall is the time to get slouchy.

Shop Slouchy Boots

Nakedvice The Sia Boot

The Attico Robin Combat Boots

Ralph Lauren Suede Tall Western Boot

Isabel Marant Dalby 55MM Leather Ankle Boot

Ganni Slouchy Pointed Toe Knee High Boot

Square Toe

It’s no secret that squared off toes have been slowly but surely on the rise. Be it stark or with rounded corners, we took note of the styles from Alaïa, Victoria Beckham, and Stella McCartney, in particular.

Shop Square Toes

Prada Patent Leather Slingback Pumps

Gucci Horsebit Ballet Flat

Balenciaga Bel Air Slide Sandal

Vagabond Shoemakers Hedda Knee High Boot

Open Edit Rowan Wedge Slide Sandal

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
